title: Intentional Contamination
description: Protection against intentional contamination including food fraud vulnerability assessment, food defense plan, crisis management, and visitor/contractor controls

requirements.text: Is there a written food fraud vulnerability assessment (FFVA) and protection plan for all types of fraud, including all incoming and outgoing products?
mandatoryStatements: Food fraud vulnerability assessment (FFVA) is documented
Assessment covers all incoming raw materials, ingredients, and packaging
Assessment covers all outgoing products
Types of food fraud considered include: substitution, dilution, counterfeiting, mislabeling, undeclared additives
Vulnerability factors are evaluated (opportunities, historical precedence, economic gain)
Fraud risks are prioritized based on vulnerability assessment
Mitigation strategies for identified fraud risks are documented
Fraud prevention plan includes supplier verification, testing, and monitoring activities
FFVA is reviewed and updated at least annually or when significant changes occur
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual review and update of FFVA, quarterly verification that mitigation activities are performed
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Ongoing supplier monitoring and testing per fraud prevention plan, immediate investigation of suspected fraud incidents

requirements.text: Is there a written food defense vulnerability assessment and food defense plan based on the risks associated with the operation?
mandatoryStatements: Food defense vulnerability assessment is documented
Assessment identifies areas vulnerable to intentional contamination
Assessment considers both insider and outsider threats
Vulnerability assessment evaluates access points, processes, and products at risk
Food defense plan is based on vulnerability assessment results
Mitigation strategies address identified vulnerabilities
Physical security measures are specified (access control, locks, barriers, surveillance)
Personnel security measures are specified (background checks, training, supervision)
Plan includes monitoring and verification activities
Food defense plan is reviewed and updated at least annually or after security incidents
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual review and update of food defense assessment and plan, quarterly verification of security controls
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Daily verification of access controls and security measures, immediate investigation of security breaches

requirements.text: Are records associated with the food defense plan and its procedures being maintained, including monitoring, corrective action and verification records (where appropriate)?
mandatoryStatements: Food defense monitoring records are maintained
Access control logs document facility entry and exit
Security system records (surveillance, alarms) are maintained
Visitor and contractor logs are maintained
Food defense training records are maintained
Security incidents and investigations are documented
Corrective actions for security breaches are documented
Verification activities (inspections, audits) are documented
Records demonstrate food defense plan is being followed
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual audit of food defense records, quarterly review of security incidents and trends
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Daily review of access logs and security system alerts, immediate documentation of security incidents

requirements.text: Is there a documented crisis management plan?
mandatoryStatements: Crisis management plan is documented
Plan defines what constitutes a crisis (recall, contamination, natural disaster, security breach, etc.)
Crisis management team is identified with roles and responsibilities
Decision-making authority during crisis is clearly defined
Communication procedures during crisis are specified (internal and external)
Plan includes templates for crisis communications
Business continuity and recovery procedures are included
Plan addresses coordination with regulatory authorities and emergency services
Crisis management plan is reviewed and updated at least annually
Crisis response drills or tabletop exercises are conducted periodically
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual review and update of crisis management plan, periodic testing through drills or tabletop exercises
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Quarterly verification of crisis team contact information, immediate activation of plan when crisis occurs

requirements.text: Is there a current list of emergency contact phone numbers for management, law enforcement and appropriate regulatory agencies?
mandatoryStatements: Emergency contact list is documented and current
List includes key management personnel with 24/7 contact information
Local law enforcement contacts are included
Relevant regulatory agencies are included (FDA, USDA, state/local health departments)
Emergency services contacts are included (fire, medical, hazmat)
Poison control and CDC contacts are included if applicable
Contact list is accessible to personnel who may need to make emergency calls
Contact list is reviewed and updated at least quarterly or when changes occur
requirements.verificationExpectations: Quarterly verification that emergency contact list is current and accessible
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Immediate update when contact information changes, quarterly review of all contact information

requirements.text: Are visitors and contractors to the company operations required to adhere to food defense procedures?
mandatoryStatements: Visitor and contractor food defense procedures are documented
Visitors and contractors are required to follow food defense procedures
Check-in and check-out procedures are established
Visitor log captures date, name, company, purpose, and escort
Identification or badges are issued to visitors and contractors
Escort requirements for different areas are defined
Visitors and contractors are briefed on relevant food safety and security rules
Access restrictions for high-risk areas are enforced
Visitor and contractor compliance is monitored during visit
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual audit of visitor control procedures, quarterly review of visitor logs for completeness
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Daily verification that visitors and contractors follow procedures, immediate intervention if non-compliance observed

capaInject: If food fraud identified or suspected: immediate hold of suspect material, investigation within 24 hours, notification to authorities if required, enhanced testing and supplier verification
If food defense vulnerability identified: immediate interim controls, implement permanent mitigation within 30 days, update food defense plan
If security breach occurs: immediate containment, investigate incident within 24 hours, implement corrective actions to prevent recurrence, update food defense plan within 14 days
If crisis occurs: activate crisis management plan immediately, document all actions, conduct post-crisis review within 30 days, implement improvements identified
If visitor or contractor violates food defense procedures: immediate removal from facility, investigate incident, enhance visitor controls within 7 days
traceabilityInject: Food fraud investigations must trace suspect materials to suppliers and products to customers
Security incident records must trace events, personnel involved, and corrective actions
Visitor and contractor logs must trace facility access to specific dates, times, and locations visited
Crisis management actions must be traceable through chronological incident logs and decision documentation
